article.headline: BYU 64, UNLV 61
article.story: PROVO, Utah (AP) -- Two free throws by Mike Hall in the final seconds of the game handed Brigham Young a 64-61 victory over UNLV Saturday. Hall blocked a 3-point attempt by Demetrius Hunter and was fouled during his scramble to retrieve the ball. The free throws sealed the Cougars' (13-7, 3-4 MWC) win, snapping their three-game losing streak, and evened their all-time series with the Runnin Rebels (12-7, 3-4) at 8-8. With 41 seconds left in the game, UNLV's leading scorer Odartey Blankson hit two free throws to give the Rebels a 61-60 lead, their first lead since the nine-minute mark, when they led 12-11. But Mark Bigelow countered with two free throws ten seconds later to give the Cougars the lead for good. Coming off a 3-for-15 performance last week against Utah, BYU's Rafael Araujo turned around his shooting, hitting 5 of 7 shots in the first half, including six points in a key 10-2 BYU run. He finished with game-highs of 18 points and 13 rebounds. Luiz Lemes had a career-high 10 assists. The Rebels committed 21 turnovers, including 15 in the first half, but had near-perfect free-throw shooting and some key 3-pointers. Blankson, who was 6-6 from the free throw line, led the Rebels with 15 points and 12 rebounds.
